column1: '''TheOneRing.net''' (often abbreviated as TORn) is a fan site dedicated to the works of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].

The site was founded in 1999 by a group of Tolkien fans eager for the upcoming ''[[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|Lord of the Rings]]'' film trilogy who were gathering information about the film. It has developed into an active world-wide community with a unique two-way relationship with the films' directors
column3: cast and crew. As of January 2010

column1: Founders Michael Regina and Erica 'Tehanu' Challis first published the site in 1999 using all of the information they could get
column2: including exclusive "spy" reports from Tehanu's visit to the [[New Zealand]] set. This activity first got her escorted off the set
column3: and then invited back on to take an official look around and meet director [[Peter Jackson]]. A designer/coder by the username of Calisuri came across the site and asked if they needed some technical help to grow the site and make it a central web location for other fans. Another technical expert usernamed Corvar also helped.<ref>[http://www.theonering.net/torwp/about/ About TheOneRing.net]</ref>

column1: What makes this fan site unique is the mutual working relationship between the crew of TheOneRing.net and that of the ''[[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|Lord of the Rings]]'' movies
column2: and now ''[[The Hobbit (film series)|The Hobbit]]''. This relationship enables the site to bring its readers exclusive news from the set.
